nodes.long_description:
ENGAGE is a next generation communications platform. It empowers educators, companies and event planners to host meetings, presentations, classes and events with people across the world. 

Using the platform, virtual reality training and experiences can be created in minutes. The tools are very easy to use and require no technical expertise. You can choose to host your virtual reality sessions live, or record and save them for others to experience later. A wide variety of effective and immersive virtual experiences can be created with an extensive library of virtual objects, effects and virtual locations available via the platform.

You can host virtual events, stream in media or simply explore user generated content the possibilities are endless. 

ENGAGE | Communicate. Teach. Learn.
nodes.short_description: ENGAGE is a next generation communications platform. It empowers educators, companies and event planners to host meetings, presentations, classes and events with people across the world.

nodes.change_log:
NEW
Activity Logs
- Added new IFX to the Experience Editor: 'Completion Event IFX' that allows for custom event logging in Experiences
- Added events to capture when users start and end Experiences

Experience Editor
- Added a Gaze Trigger that can activate effects when a user looks at it for a specified length of time
- Added the ability to trigger quizzes for only the user who activates the trigger
- Added the ability to set a time delay on triggered effects
- Added the ability to add colliders to imported glb models
- Added the ability to set glb models as interactive IFX so they can have physics applied to them or be used as object triggers

AI
- Replaced Open AI Chat Completions method with the newer Responses API, following OpenAI’s recommendation for improved capabilities and long-term support
- Simplified the User Interface of the Character builder to focus on important choices and hide advanced options 
- Introduced a new interaction method – ‘Hold to talk’. This sets the bot to listen while you keep the interaction button held down and immediately stops listening upon release. 
- Added a ‘chunk size’ option for Text-to-speech) to allow for creators to select their own trade-off between contextual understanding and processing speed. 
- Added OpenAI as a text-to-speech provider 
- Added OpenAI as a voice recognition provider. This is a dynamic multilingual model that can detect the spoken language as it is spoken. This model is selected by default 
- Added Elevenlabs as an optional voice recognition provider. This also provides dynamic multilingual voice recognition 
- Added the ability to select the ‘default model’ which will set the AI Model to be the ENGAGE recommended model, and update automatically as our recommendations change over time
- Added a new function that allows the AI to deliver an ENGAGE (or LMS) quiz to the user and then receive the results to provide feedback to the user. 
- Added the ability to duplicate an existing AI character 
- Added a Function: “Load any IFX Object” - which searches the IFX library for the any available IFX and loads in the session 
- Added a Function: “Code Interpreter”, which allows the bot to run calculations and simulations to provide better answers to numerical problems
- Added support for GPT 5.1 

IMPROVED
- Reduced CPU usage of Avatars
- Improved login speed for users who are members of many groups
- Improved load time on Experiences
- Experiences now cache Cloud files as part of the experience loading process, eliminating 'pop in'


FIXED
- Fixed an issue where some IFX stated that they had colliders, but they did not. 
- Fixed an issue on desktop where resizing the ENGAGE window could cause the UI to resize and get too small to be usable
- Fixed an issue where, when users with access to many groups view Dashboards in Safari, it can cause the browser to freeze

FIXED
- Fixed an issue where GLB files in snapshots or experiences can be positioned incorrectly
- Fixed an issue where GLB files may not display textures correctly
- Fixed an issue where animated GLBs did not auto-start their animation
- Fixed an issue where the Emoji reactions text appeared below the menu in 'Session Settings'

NEW
- Added a new, full-featured personal drawing pad to facilitate both private and collaborative drawing.
- Added support for the Logitech MX Ink stylus for users of Quest 2, Quest 3, and Quest 3S headsets. This includes left and right handed use for drawing on surfaces, adjusting line style in response to applied pressure, drawing in the air with the 3D pen, and navigating through ENGAGE.
- Added the ability for the drawings on a whiteboard to be captured in a spatial recording.
- Redesigned the tool panel used when drawing on a whiteboard in VR.
- Added the ability to capture a 2D video recording from either an avatar's point of view or the view from a camera IFX. Users can add multiple camera IFX and switch between capture sources during the recording.
- Introduced limits on the number of LITE users that can join some types of session.
- Renamed the Content Editor to the Experience Editor. The files that users create in the Experience Editor are now called Experiences.


IMPROVED
- Reduced the space requirements when a host summons users in a session and set all users to be summoned to the same point.
- Enabled users on VR devices to use the trigger button to select UI elements at close range. Previously, tapping was the only way to select UI elements at close range.
- Updated the default ElevenLabs voice to a more recent model. Users can override it with their own selection.
- Adjusted the selectable area for delete and lock buttons on sticky notes to better match the boundary of the button graphics and prevent accidental selection.


FIXED
- Fixed 2FA code entry so that users on desktop devices can submit with the return key and users on VR devices can submit with the return button on the virtual keyboard. 
- Fixed the moving seats that are used in some vehicle IFX.
- Fixed the ability to replace the audio in a spatial recording.
- Fixed an issue that caused a user's credentials to be rejected the first time they tried to log in to ENGAGE after they registered for an account in the web manager.
- Fixed the ability to activate selection triggers at long distances on VR devices.
- Fixed an issue that could prevent a user on a Meta Quest headset from being able to save an experience.
- Fixed the application's request for permissions that are required to use mixed reality.
- Fixed an issue that caused the delete key to not work in some areas of the UI.
- Fixed an issue that could cause a user to accidentally move their virtual keyboard while it was hidden.
